Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputEventListener
public class GameController extends Object implements InputEventListener
The GameController connects the game logic (Board) with the GUI.

It listens to key events from the player and tells the board what to do. After the board updates, this controller sends the new data back to the GUI so the screen can refresh.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(GuiController c)
      Creates a new GameController. It also prepares the first brick and sets up the link to the GUI.
      Parameters:
      c - the GuiController that handles the visual part of the game

  • Method Details

    • onDownEvent

      public DownData onDownEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Called when the player or the auto-drop tries to move the brick down.

      If the brick can move down, thn just update the view. If it cannot, then merge it into the background, clear rows,update score, spawn a new brick, and check for game over.

      Specified by:
      onDownEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - information about who triggered the move (user or timer)
      Returns:
      DownData containing info about cleared rows and the updated view

    • onLeftEvent

      public ViewData onLeftEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Moves the brick to left.
      Specified by:
      onLeftEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - the move event
      Returns:
      updated ViewData for the GUI
